text: I would suggest that you continue
pruning from his home just outside
London this doctors helping treat a
patient in Lahore holding a tablet a
doctor there shows him the intensive
care ward for coronavirus patients via
videolink
hospitals in the country have been
stretched through this software they can
share case notes doctor octa helped lead
the cove in 19 response in this part of
britain now he wants his experiences to
help his country of birth we're very
proud of the NHS service we're giving
here and because of our relationships
both in medicine and otherwise in
Pakistan it was very important for us to
help our colleagues and to help the
people of Pakistan the health care
system in Pakistan has always been under
resourced and whilst in some cities the
number of new cases now appears to be
decreasing coronavirus has highlighted
its weaknesses to ease the pressure this
london-based doctor created a series of
telemedicine portals through this one
doctors here can hold consultations with
coronavirus patients in Pakistan we
haven't got resources there to really
plug the gaps of service so any skill
any special skill from UK will be warmly
welcomed in Pakistan where doctor and
patient can speak the same language we
can create a bridge no matter where they
are through telemedicine so far recorded
deaths in Pakistan have been far lower
than in the UK the doctors taking part
in this scheme hope they can do their
part to save lives in both countries
secondo Kimani BBC news
